question: As per the global ratings agency Standard & Poor’s (S&P), what is the estimated growth rate of India in the financial year 2020-21?
explanation:
Global ratings agency Standard & Poor’s (S&P) has recently released its forecast of the growth estimate of India for FY21 (2020-21).
As per the release, S&P has slashed the GDP growth estimate for India to 1.8% from its previous estimate of 3.5%. The agency also expressed its concern that the peak point of the Covid-19 outbreak has not yet reached and it is expected to occur a little later than many other countries.
